candidates.title: chore(deps): bump ethers-derive-eip712 from 2.0.1 to 2.0.2
candidates.body:
Bumps [ethers-derive-eip712](https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs) from 2.0.1 to 2.0.2.
Release notes

Sourced from ethers-derive-eip712's releases.

ethers-v2.0.2

What's Changed

  • ci: rm celo integration test, install missing solc version by @​gakonst in gakonst/ethers-rs#2292
  • fix: enable doc_cfg feature for docsrs by @​DaniPopes in gakonst/ethers-rs#2294
  • fix: broken eip155 logic in aws signer by @​xJonathanLEI in gakonst/ethers-rs#2300
  • chore: add eyre dependency by @​kkthmyh in gakonst/ethers-rs#2305
  • fix: ambiguous_glob_reexports rustc lint by @​DaniPopes in gakonst/ethers-rs#2301

New Contributors

  • @​kkthmyh made their first contribution in gakonst/ethers-rs#2305

Full Changelog: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/compare/ethers-v2.0.1...ethers-v2.0.2

Changelog

Sourced from ethers-derive-eip712's changelog.

[2.0.2] - 2023-03-28

Bug Fixes

  • Ensure ethers-solc has tokio-rt-multithread
  • Ambiguous_glob_reexports rustc lint (#2301)
  • Broken eip155 logic in aws signer (#2300)
  • Enable doc_cfg feature for docsrs (#2294)
  • Add missing feature on ethers tests
  • Ethers-contract circular dep on ethers-signers (#2291)
  • Features (#2290)
  • Handle all struct field types (#2289)
  • Re-export CallLogFrame from geth types (#2283)
  • Feature resolution (#2274)
  • Use to_string in mainnet chain variant (#2275)
  • Accept ethlive as a chain name (#2268)
  • Fix missing ident # (#2267)
  • Support null result (#2249)
  • Ensure flatten target is part of graph (#2256)
  • Dont poll stream again if done (#2245)
  • Docsrs builds final (#2235)
  • Docs.rs build (#2221)
  • Change windows target ABI (#2230)
  • Init guard in noncemanager (#2227)
  • Parse_log in public interface (#2228)
  • Allow MIT-0, allow CC0-1.0 exceptions (#2212)
  • Udeps (#2215)
  • Set miner.etherbase in clique mode (#2210)
  • Examples (#2207)
  • Properly parse genesis alloc storage (#2205)
  • I256 docs (#2187)
  • Builtin trait derives (#2170)
  • Block FromStr implementation (#2155)
  • Use event name from abi attribute (#2144)
  • Report all errors during parsing (#2149)
  • Examples (#2153)
  • Test hive genesis parsing (#2145)
  • Process all imports even input files (#2136)
  • Fix autodetection edge case (#2099)
  • Add cfg to IntoFuture preventing Send (#2086)
  • Use middleware associated err type (#2093)
  • Add Send bound to return type of JsonRpcClient::request (#2072)
  • Add getrandom with js feature for wasm (#2076)
  • Add missing pub for tuple structs (#2080)
  • Ensure urls have trailing / (#2069)
  • Fix geth --init temp dir race condition (#2068)
  • Default to Ascii for windows / Utf8 otherwise (#2060)
  • Add missing ir option (#2055)
  • Add back mod util
  • Fixed issue#2004 parsing solc verison with trailing newlines (#2005)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • e26f42a chore: release
  • bf146cd fix: ensure ethers-solc has tokio-rt-multithread
  • 5060fe6 chore: release
  • 1d740a6 chore: bump generic-array
  • 27f895f fix: ambiguous_glob_reexports rustc lint (#2301)
  • e96cc7e chore: add eyre dependency (#2305)
  • 36dac58 fix: broken eip155 logic in aws signer (#2300)
  • 16f9fab fix: enable doc_cfg feature for docsrs (#2294)
  • 80ac394 test: ensure multithreaded tokio rt
  • 797488e fix: add missing feature on ethers tests
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: chore(deps): bump tokio from 1.26.0 to 1.27.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.26.0 to 1.27.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.27.0

1.27.0 (March 27th, 2023)

This release bumps the MSRV of Tokio to 1.56. (#5559)

Added

  • io: add async_io helper method to sockets (#5512)
  • io: add implementations of AsFd/AsHandle/AsSocket (#5514, #5540)
  • net: add UdpSocket::peek_sender() (#5520)
  • sync: add RwLockWriteGuard::{downgrade_map, try_downgrade_map} (#5527)
  • task: add JoinHandle::abort_handle (#5543)

Changed

  • io: use memchr from libc (#5558)
  • macros: accept path as crate rename in #[tokio::main] (#5557)
  • macros: update to syn 2.0.0 (#5572)
  • time: don't register for a wakeup when Interval returns Ready (#5553)

Fixed

  • fs: fuse std iterator in ReadDir (#5555)
  • tracing: fix spawn_blocking location fields (#5573)
  • time: clean up redundant check in Wheel::poll() (#5574)

Documented

  • macros: define cancellation safety (#5525)
  • io: add details to docs of tokio::io::copy[_buf] (#5575)
  • io: refer to ReaderStream and StreamReader in module docs (#5576)

#5512: tokio-rs/tokio#5512 #5514: tokio-rs/tokio#5514 #5520: tokio-rs/tokio#5520 #5525: tokio-rs/tokio#5525 #5527: tokio-rs/tokio#5527 #5540: tokio-rs/tokio#5540 #5543: tokio-rs/tokio#5543 #5553: tokio-rs/tokio#5553 #5555: tokio-rs/tokio#5555 #5557: tokio-rs/tokio#5557 #5558: tokio-rs/tokio#5558 #5559: tokio-rs/tokio#5559 #5572: tokio-rs/tokio#5572 #5573: tokio-rs/tokio#5573 #5574: tokio-rs/tokio#5574 #5575: tokio-rs/tokio#5575 #5576: tokio-rs/tokio#5576

Commits
  • 1df874e chore: prepare Tokio v1.27.0 (#5584)
  • 614fe35 chore: prepare tokio-macros v2.0.0 (#5580)
  • 68b02db time: fix wake-up with interval on Ready (#5553)
  • 822af18 sync: fix Semaphore::MAX_PERMITS test (#5582)
  • 92d33b7 macros: update syn (#5572)
  • 1cb7bf1 time: clean up redundant check in Wheel::poll() (#5574)
  • 768ede6 io: refer to ReaderStream and StreamReader in module docs (#5576)
  • 54a3946 io: add details to docs of tokio::io::copy[_buf] (#5575)
  • 35dd635 tracing: fix spawn_blocking location fields (#5573)
  • a7bb054 tokio: update stream, util, test to 2021 edition (#5571)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

This is the first release using automated releases that @​DaniPopes wrote in gakonst/ethers-rs#2278. Changelog empty for now, but next releases should start being nicer.

Sourced from ethers-derive-eip712's changelog.

Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

This changelog is automatically generated by git-cliff, which is configured here.

Please do not manually edit this file.

Bumps [reqwest](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest) from 0.11.14 to 0.11.16.

Sourced from reqwest's releases.

v0.11.16

What's Changed

  • Fix building docs on docs.rs by @​NobodyXu in seanmonstar/reqwest#1789
  • Set 'rust-version` in Cargo metadata and use it in the MSRV build job by @​nickelc in seanmonstar/reqwest#1793

  • Add RequestBuilder methods to split and reconstruct from its parts.
  • Add experimental HTTP/3 support. 🧪3️🎉

candidates.title: feature: add Discord bot support
basic args validation and improve logs
candidates.body:
### Description
Added validations to a couple of the start-up configurations

- graph_node_endpoint - by an indexing statuses query
- private_key - by parsing to an Ethereum wallet
- registry_subgraph - by indexer id query
- network_subgraph - by indexer_stake query
- graphcast_network - limited to mainnet or testnet, can be relaxed later
- collect_message_duration - minimum set to 0
- boot_node_addresses - by parsing to MultiAddr
- log_level - by setting up the logger

Skipping
- topics - no validation needed
- waku_host, waku_port, waku_node_key, waku_log_level - Waku input get validated when creating Graphcast agent

Later add validation to optional arguments if they were provided
- metrics_url
- slack_token
- slack_webhook

Improved SDK logs to 
- Remove info logs on "Message Received" and "Sent message id"
- changed hierarchy of many smaller info and debug logs

### Issue link (if applicable)
Helps with graphops/poi-radio#53

candidates.title: clap CLI arguments
candidates.body:
### Description

Basic arguments with types, defaults, and validation. 
`.env` is used first and supplied to CLI if not specified. 
Included functions to parse config file in `toml` format but did not use it for replacing the existing functions.

For next steps, we can add more validations to inputs and actually utilize the config file to load arguments. 


For now `help` looks something like this
```
graphcast 
GraphOps
Gossip realtime information for the emerging data marketplace

USAGE:
    ping-pong [OPTIONS] --graph-node-endpoint <ENDPOINT> --private-key <KEY>

OPTIONS:
        --boot-node-addresses <NODE_ADDRESSES>
            Static list of waku boot nodes to connect to [env: BOOT_NODE_ADDRESSES=] [default: ]

        --collect-message-duration [<COLLECT_MESSAGE_DURATION>...]
            Set the minimum duration to wait for a topic message collection [env:
            COLLECT_MESSAGE_DURATION=] [default: 120]

        --config-file <CONFIG_FILE>
            path to the Graphcast radio configuration file (Unimplemented) [env: GRAPHCAST_CONFIG=]

        --graph-node-endpoint <ENDPOINT>
            API endpoint to the Graph Node Status Endpoint [env:
            GRAPH_NODE_STATUS_ENDPOINT=http://localhost:8030/graphql]

        --graphcast-network <NAME>
            Supported Graphcast networks: mainnet, testnet [env: GRAPHCAST_NETWORK=] [default:
            testnet]

    -h, --help
            Print help information

        --log-level <LOG_LEVEL>
            logging configurationt to set as RUST_LOG [env: RUST_LOG=] [default: info]

        --metrics-url <HOST:PORT>
            Metrics endpoint to query/scrape [env: METRICS_URL=]

        --network-subgraph <SUBGRAPH>
            Subgraph endpoint to The Graph network subgraph [env: NETWORK_SUBGRAPH=] [default:
            https://gateway.testnet.thegraph.com/network]

        --private-key <KEY>
            Private key to the Graphcase ID wallet [env: PRIVATE_KEY]

        --registry-subgraph <SUBGRAPH>
            Subgraph endpoint to the Graphcast Registry [env: REGISTRY_SUBGRAPH=] [default:
            https://api.thegraph.com/subgraphs/name/hopeyen/graphcast-registry-goerli]

        --slack-token <SLACK_TOKEN>
            Slack bot API token [env: SLACK_TOKEN=]

        --slack-webhook <SLACK_WEBHOOK>
            Webhook to the Slack bot App [env: SLACK_WEBHOOK=]

        --topics <[TOPIC]>
            Additional topics to subscribe to [env: TOPICS=]

        --waku-host <WAKU_HOST>
            Host for the GraphQL HTTP server [env: WAKU_HOST=]

        --waku-log-level <WAKU_LOG_LEVEL>
            Waku node logging configuration [env: WAKU_LOG_LEVEL=]

        --waku-node-key <KEY>
            Private key to the Waku node id [env: WAKU_NODE_KEY]

        --waku-port <WAKU_PORT>
            Port for the GraphQL HTTP server [env: WAKU_PORT=]
```

### Issue link (if applicable)
resolves #70

candidates.title: content topic poll and update
candidates.body:
### Description
Added a function to add new content topics to the filter protocol subscriptions.
- To make better update process such as to unsubscribe old topics, we need to make graphcast object mutable, which then require many operations to be unsafe
- We can later discuss how should the older topics be removed, if it should be some period after the indexer/operator has moved away from a particular Graph entity such as closing an allocation

I wanted to make a curried function similar to register signal handler, but want to first leave more control for individual radio to make periodic calls for updates as well as the query function structure

### Issue link (if applicable)
Partially resolves graphops/poi-radio#32

candidates.body:
This PR removes the need to use a file to store a boot note multiaddr. Because now a light node will try to connect to active boot nodes by default, it's not needed to first run a boot node and store the multiaddr in a file and then running a light node that uses that boot node id. With this PR a boot node multiaddr can be passed in with an env variable, and it will be used if the light node cannot find a hosted boot node.

Next steps:
Currently there are a lot of scattered environment variables around the codebase, we should use something like [clap](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap) to manage environment variables on application startup.

candidates.title: perf: protocol in pubsub topic + handle null blocks
candidates.body:
### Description

Add CAIP-2 chain id to part of graphcast pubsub topic to separate messages for different Eth chains.
Add handle to not panic on null blocks from the block provider.

### Issue link (if applicable)
Closes #58 
Closes #57

candidates.title: refactor: improve logging (add tracing crate)
candidates.body:
Switch to using [tracing](https://crates.io/crates/tracing) instead of `println!()` for logging. 
Next steps:
- Add support for Prometheus (check out [this guide](https://tokio.rs/tokio/topics/tracing-next-steps))

candidates.title: hotfix: rollback bindings dep
candidates.body:
Off the back of https://github.com/graphops/graphcast-sdk/issues/45
This does not solve the issues, when we bump our version of the bindings we should update our codebase to make sure everything still works.

candidates.title: feat: crates publication ready
candidates.body:
### Description
This PR updates waku dependency path such that the `graphcast` crate can be published.

The new Discv5 feature is currently not used.

candidates.title: Allow users to configure subgraph urls and subtopics
candidates.body:
### Description
This PR introduces changes that are needed to support [integration tests for the POI Radio](https://github.com/graphops/poi-radio/pull/2) (and integration testing for Radios in general)

Changes:
- Switch to using env vars for `REGISTRY_SUBGRAPH` and `NETWORK_SUBGRAPH`
- Allow Radio developers to override the default subtopics by passing another argument to `GossipAgent::new()`
- Removes POI Radio from `examples/` folder (removes the whole folder actually, but it's being added back in the [ping-pong Radio PR](https://github.com/graphops/graphcast-sdk/pull/33))
### Issue link (if applicable)
Will solve https://github.com/graphops/graphcast-sdk/issues/32

candidates.title: feat: peer discovery with consistent DNS enrtree url
candidates.body:
### Description

Utilize CLI [tool](https://github.com/status-im/nim-dnsdisc) `tree_creator` to generate a ENR record tree signed by a consistent key pair. 
Manually set up DNS records on Cloudflare under the domain `graphcast.xyz`, then provide the ENR tree url for peer discovery.

Configurable tree url with fallback default at `enrtree://AMRFINDNF7XHQN2XBYCGYAYSQ3NV77RJIHLX6HJLA6ZAF365NRLMM@graphcast.xyz`

### Issue link (if applicable)
Resolves #15 
-> later set up automated process for keeping the record tree updated

candidates.title: Add ping-pong Radio
candidates.body:
Adds ping-pong Radio example, mostly for the docs on basic Radio development. It should serve as the most straightforward and easy example guide to get started with building a new Radio. Doesn't use JSON for the content.

Once this PR gets approved I'll make the respective changes in https://github.com/graphops/poi-crosschecker-radio as well.

candidates.title: Persistence node addr for DNS discovery with static list fallback
candidates.body:
### Description
Every time a node has been restarted without Secp256k1 private key, a random key pair for configuring the waku node and thus create an unique peer id. 
- Allow radio to utilize the operator private key with optional host and port so that a static node list can be kept across restarts.
- Implemented DNS peer discovery with a hardcoded URL and fallback to the default static node list - have not test the function with a functional DNS url that serves the ENRtree zone file.
- Fixed a minor bug on using env var `port` when constructing boot node multiaddr instead of a constant `60000`

### Issue link (if applicable)
Static node impl for #15

candidates.title: Update README to factor out Radio-specific contents
candidates.body:
### Description
Removes all POI cross-checker Radio specific contents from the README and leave only SDK level contents. Also adds a badge that directly links to the docs portal so that we don't manually copy docs over every time there's a new update.

### Issue link (if applicable)
https://github.com/graphops/graphcast-sdk/issues/25

candidates.title: Configurable waku host and port with fallback
candidates.body:
### Description
Factor out waku node configurations for the difference between boot nodes (enable relay and filter protocol, waiting for bindings to support `isFilterFullNode`), and light nodes (only enable filter protocol with filter subscription). 
Favor storing boot node `Multiaddr` rather than `peer_id` for the later structuring of ENR tree.
Allow configuration such that users can decide where to host and port the nodes particularly when managing multiple node instances.

### Issue link (if applicable)
Improvement to #23

candidates.title: feat: initial slack bot messaging
candidates.body:
### Description

Slack notification when attestations resulted in conflicts.
- Sending attestation conflict in the channel #graphcast-slackbot 
- Color codes or construct the slack message more explicitly 
- Take Slack OAuth token from `https://api.slack.com/apps/___your_bot___/oauth?`
- Take Slack webhood link from `https://api.slack.com/apps/___your_bot___/incoming-webhooks?`


Resolves #27

candidates.title: Content topic - relay and filter separation
candidates.body:
### Description
Utilize the Waku Filter protocol to filter messages for lightweight relay nodes. 

Routing should continue as before between relaying nodes, but with filter protocol enabled, the node will pull down messages that match subscribed content topic.
- all messages are relayed using the relay protocol on `graphcast` pubsub topic regardless of content topic.
- Nodes will be a lightnode when filter protocol is enabled, so separate full node is required to relay requests. Test fleet or boot fleet seems to make sense to be a perfect place for this configuration.


May further refactor boot node and light node setups later on. 

### Issue link (if applicable)
Follow up to complete issue #14

candidates.title: Radio - payload string, error handling
candidates.body:
### Description
Removed extra Radio definitions for simple requirement of `content: String`

+ added handling for validating sender and registry. 

### Issue link (if applicable)
[The most basic UX for issue described here](https://github.com/graphops/graphcast-sdk/issues/18)

candidates.title: Repo checklist
candidates.body:
Add necessary items to make repo public.
Once this is merged we can rename the repo to `graphcast-sdk` and make it public.

candidates.title: Initial docstrings
candidates.body:
Run either `cargo doc` or `cargo doc --open`

Only an initial version, to be more populated and detailed later on

candidates.title: Refactor POI radio as an example
candidates.body:
Added a `GossipAgent` module for an initial refactoring of GossipMessages and specific radio usages.

Factor POI radio related operations and event loop to `/examples`.

Plan to further refactor query function and parsing function when implementing more dynamic queries and radio payload buffers.

To spin up example instance of POI crosschecker radio: `cargo run --example poi-crosschecker [boot]`

candidates.title: Remove waku rust bindings source code
candidates.body:
New repo structure for standalone `graphcast` package, transfer waku rust bindings source code to dependency link to github. 

Updated the repo to catch up from the fork at the beginning of the project (namely using the `Cow` type in topic names)

candidates.title: Network subgraph struct
candidates.body:
- For more flexible graphQL queries, we avoid having to generate graphql source files manually and utilize graphQL Client Response type. 
- Based on response, a `Network` struct to keep track of network minimum indexer stake requirement and optional indexer information with helper functions implemented to access fields later
- Added `QueryError` type
- Unit testing for helper functions

Next steps:
- Perhaps refactor graphQL client across all endpoints
- Discuss Network query efficiency (query all indexer at once and store the data, or only query when received relevant messages)

candidates.title: Add global nonces map.
candidates.body:
Adds a global mutable Map that will store nonces.

Will use the "Rebase and Merge" option since commits are messy again.

candidates.title: Message validity + Error handling
candidates.body:
For each incoming messages, added message validity check
- Resolve sender identity through the gossip registry subgraph to an indexer 
- Indexer self stake stake checked against network subgraph indexer stake minimum requirement
- Message nonce as timestamp checked to be within the locally defined limit of 1hour
- Using block number, checked the block hash against the user provided Ethereum provider endpoint

Added error handling => Can later be grouped and identified as something similar to
- QueryingError("Could not query {} from endpoint {}",,)
- ParsingError("Could not parse {} into type {}",,)
- CorruptedMessage("Failed to validate message: Error{}",)
- ...

chosen_pr.title: chore(deps): bump tokio from 1.26.0 to 1.27.0
chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.26.0 to 1.27.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.27.0

1.27.0 (March 27th, 2023)

This release bumps the MSRV of Tokio to 1.56. (#5559)

Added

  • io: add async_io helper method to sockets (#5512)
  • io: add implementations of AsFd/AsHandle/AsSocket (#5514, #5540)
  • net: add UdpSocket::peek_sender() (#5520)
  • sync: add RwLockWriteGuard::{downgrade_map, try_downgrade_map} (#5527)
  • task: add JoinHandle::abort_handle (#5543)

Changed

  • io: use memchr from libc (#5558)
  • macros: accept path as crate rename in #[tokio::main] (#5557)
  • macros: update to syn 2.0.0 (#5572)
  • time: don't register for a wakeup when Interval returns Ready (#5553)

Fixed

  • fs: fuse std iterator in ReadDir (#5555)
  • tracing: fix spawn_blocking location fields (#5573)
  • time: clean up redundant check in Wheel::poll() (#5574)

Documented

  • macros: define cancellation safety (#5525)
  • io: add details to docs of tokio::io::copy[_buf] (#5575)
  • io: refer to ReaderStream and StreamReader in module docs (#5576)

Commits
  • 1df874e chore: prepare Tokio v1.27.0 (#5584)
  • 614fe35 chore: prepare tokio-macros v2.0.0 (#5580)
  • 68b02db time: fix wake-up with interval on Ready (#5553)
  • 822af18 sync: fix Semaphore::MAX_PERMITS test (#5582)
  • 92d33b7 macros: update syn (#5572)
  • 1cb7bf1 time: clean up redundant check in Wheel::poll() (#5574)
  • 768ede6 io: refer to ReaderStream and StreamReader in module docs (#5576)

  • 35dd635 tracing: fix spawn_blocking location fields (#5573)
